verses.verse: {The Servant of the Lord} d "Here is my servant, whom I support, my chosen one, in whom I delight. {Lit. whom my soul delights} I've placed my Spirit upon him; and {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack and} he'll deliver his {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack his} justice throughout the world. {Lit. justice to the nations}
He won't shout, or raise his voice, or make it heard in the street.

A crushed reed he will not break, and a fading candle {Lit. fading linen wick} he won't snuff out. {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads quench it} He'll bring forth {I. e. will demonstrate} justice for the truth.

And {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa h MT lack And} he won't grow faint or be crushed until he establishes justice on the mainland, and the coastlands take ownership of {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read the islands wait for (cf. 4QIsa h )} his Law."

{God Speaks about the Servant} d This is what God says the God {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa a corrector reads and ; MT reads the Lord} who created the heavens and stretched them out, who spread out the earth and its produce, who gives breath to the people on it and life {Lit. spirit} to those who walk in it:

"I've {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa h MT read I, the Lord, have ; LXX reads I, the Lord God, have} called you in righteousness. I'll take hold of your hand. I'll preserve you and appoint you as a covenant to the people, {So 1QIsa a MT LXX; 4QIsa h reads as an everlasting covenant} as a light for the nations,
to open blind eyes and to bring out those who are bound {So 1QIsa a LXX; 4QIsa h MT read out prisoners} from their cells, and {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa h MT lack and} those sitting in darkness from prison.
I, the Lord , am the one, and I won't give my name and {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa h MT LXX read I am the LORD; that is my name. I won't give my} glory to another, nor my praise to idols.
See, the former things have taken place, and I'm announcing the {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa b 4QIsa h MT LXX lack the} new things before they spring into being I'm telling you about them."

{Praise in Song to God} d Sing to the Lord a new song, and {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa h MT lack and} his praise from the ends of the earth, you who sail down the sea and by everything in it, you coastlands and their inhabitants.

Let the desert cry out, {So 1QIsa a 4QIsa h LXX (singular); MT (plural)} its towns and the {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read and its towns} villages where Kedar lives; and {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks and} let those who live in Sela sing for joy. Let them shout aloud {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads them cry joyfully} from the mountaintops.
Let them give glory to the Lord , and declare his praise in the islands.

The Lord marches out like a warrior; he stirs up his rage like a man of war; he makes his anger heard; he shouts aloud; {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads He makes a war cry and shouts out his anger} he declares his mastery over his enemies:

"I have certainly {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks certainly} stayed silent for a long time; I've kept still and held myself back. Now, like a woman giving birth, I'll cry out. All of a sudden I'll gasp and pant.
I'll devastate the mountains and hills, and dry up all their vegetation; I'll turn rivers into islands, and dry up the ponds.

I'll help the blind walk, even {Or and ; so 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks even} on a road they do not know; I'll guide them in directions {Lit. paths} they do not know. I'll turn the dark places {So 1QIsa a (misspelling places ); MT LXX read darkness} into light in front of them, and the rough places into level ground. These are the things I will do, and I won't abandon them.

Those who trust in carved idols will turn back and {So 1QIsa a ; the Heb. lacks and} be completely disappointed, {So 1QIsa a MT LXX; MT ms lacks disappointed} along with those {1QIsa a MT LXX lack along with those} who say to metal images, «You are our gods.»"
{God Rebukes Israel} d "Listen, you deaf people, and look up, you blind people, so you may see!
Who is blind except my servant, or deaf like my messenger I am sending? Who is blind like the one committed to me, or blind like the Lord's servant?

You've seen {So 1QIsa a MT; MT qere reads To see (or He sees )} many things, but you pay no {So 1QIsa a MT LXX; MT mss read he pays no} attention. His ears are open, {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads to open ; or are open} but he doesn't listen.
The Lord was pleased, for the sake of his vindication, that he should magnify his Law and make it glorious.

But this is a people who have been robbed and plundered, all of them trapped in pits or hidden away in prisons. {So 1QIsa a MT LXX; 4QIsa g reads prison} They have become prey, with no one to rescue them; they have been made loot, with no one to say, «Send them back!'
"Who among you will listen, and {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack and} pay attention, and listen for the time to come?"

{God Punishes Israel} d "Who handed Jacob over to looters, and Israel to robbers? Was it not the Lord , against whom we have sinned? After all, they weren't willing to walk in his ways, and they wouldn't obey {Or wouldn't listen to} his instruction,

so he drenched him with {Lit. he poured out on him} the heat that is his anger, {So 1QIsa a LXX; 4QIsa g MT read the heat, his anger} the violence of war. It enveloped him in flames, but still he had no insight. It burned him up, but he didn't take it to heart."
